purpose: facts that needed reinforcement (e.g. got it wrong on a Q-bank)
text: <@U70RREU02> set the channel purpose: facts that needed reinforcement (e.g. got it wrong on a Q-bank)
TB is intracellular; thereby TH1 cells mediate the response with granulomas, stimulating formation of giant cells, etc.
HIV begets superficial _candida_ infections, not systemic fungal ones
_Legionella_ can be visualized on BYCE or silver stain; spread through water systems; a common cause of nosocomial pneumonia
Viral tissue/cell affinity is generally determined by surface glycoproteins; other processes, such as endonucleases, proteases, etc. deal with affinity-independent viral replication

Intra-RBC ring inclusions visualized in microscopy generally indicate one of two diseases: malaria, or babesiosis. Clinical presentations of both are similar; with babesiosis caused by ticks and malaria by mosquitos
_Aedes_ mosquito begets Dengue fever: fever, polyarthritis, macular rash. The polyarthritis and source separates it from similar Typhoid fever
Ampicillin treats _Listeria_ infection, which can occur with eating soft cheeses or milk
Congenital toxoplasmosis is acquired in utero, characterized by: hydrocephalus, intracranial calcifications, and choriorentinitis. Avoided by having mothers avoid cat feces.

NSAIDS can contribute to high blood pressure via reducing GFR: reduced GFR also reduces Na+ excretion; reduced Na+ excretion increases osmolarity of the blood; increased osmolarity of the blood increases volume; increased blood volume -> increased pressure
NSAIDs can also contribute acute nephritis, even causing papillary necrosis
Allopurinol can cause DRESS syndrome; a systemic reaction with eosinophilia and systemic symptoms
